question: Are there any scholarships or financial aid offered to students and what are the basis?
answer: ​Different financial aid packages and scholarships are available at AUB.​You may review the information and contact theOffice of Financial Aidfor details regarding your financial aid/scholarship questions.

question: Is 'distance learning' or 'studies by correspondence' available at AUB?
answer:
​Unless stated otherwise for a specific diploma/course (ex: Pro-Green
Diploma), in general, regular attendance in classes, lectures, labs, and
seminars is mandatory to qualify for graduation with a degree from
AUB.​

question: We would like to visit the AUB campus and the Office of Admissions.  What are the Office of Admissions operating hours and do we need to take an appointment?
answer: You are welcome to visit the AUB campus and make a tour of it. You can arrange/schedule a tour with theVisitors' Bureau. While, at any time, you may check thevirtual campus tour.​However, no appointment is required to visit the Office of Admissions; you are welcome anytime during the office hours that can be reviewed along with campus location information at our 'contact us' page.​

question: What are the fees incurred for ´X-major´ at AUB and what are other fees?
answer: ​Please refer to theuniversity catalogueto know the number of credits require by a specific major.  You may also check theTuition calculatoror thetuition per credit costs​.​

question: What is the language of instruction at AUB?
answer: ​All courses are taught in the English language except Arabic courses.

question: What kind of accommodation facilities are there on campus?
answer:
​There are six residence halls on campus (four for women and two for men)
in addition to one off campus (for women). For more information, please
contactAUB Student Housing​.

question: I am accepted and paid my confirmation fee, why can't I login to AUBsis to apply for residence in student dorms?
answer: For the purpose of applying for residence in the students dorms, you can access AUBsis with your default AUBsis Pin which is your birthdate in the format MMDDYY (ex: for 5 Dec 2001, default pin is 120501) after payment of the confirmation fee​.If you are unable to login with the default pin then please email us (admissions@aub.edu.lb) to reset it for you.  Upon reset, you would be able to login to AUBsis using the default pin.​

question: I am accepted; what are the next steps that I should do?
answer: In general, all the registration steps will be communicated to you by email in due time.​If you are interested in applying to the AUB dorms, then you should check with theAUB Student Housingon the relevant deadlines as soon as you receive your acceptance email, as dorms deadlines are usually early.   Please also note that you may apply to AUB Student Housing (dorms) upon payment of the confirmation fee.​​Students who confirm and pay the fee (details per your acceptance email), will receive​ (about 1 month before the start of classes) a welcome email that will contain additional information regarding new student orientation, course registration, academic advising among other important information.​You should plan to arrive to AUB for the new student orientation, which is usually one week before the start of classes.

question: How can I send my exam (ex: SAT, IELTS, TOEFL etc.) scores to AUB?
answer: Your scores needs to be sent officially to AUB (ETS Code 0902) directly from the organization administering the test; you should also send your unofficial scores showing your full name (ex: as printed/downloaded from the website of the organization administering the test) by email to AUB.​For SAT Scores, please refer to the"How to send your SAT Scores​​" instructions​for details on how to properly send your SAT Scores.

question: Can I postpone my acceptance to a later term?
answer:
​You may request to postpone your acceptance by one term, by replying to
your acceptance email and requesting it.  We will review your request
and provide you feedback or confirmation regarding your postponement request.

question: Why have I not received my acceptance email yet?
answer: Accepted students will receive their acceptance by email.  If you have not received your acceptance by email then please check that the acceptance email didn't get routed to your junk email folder.  ​If you cannot find it, then please email your AUB application ID number and your correct email address toadmissions@aub.edu.lb(undergraduate acceptances) orgrad-admissions@aub.edu.lb(for graduate acceptances) so we can correct your email if necessary and re-send your acceptance email.​It is very important that you submit a correct email address on your application form as important notifications regarding your application will be sent by email only.​

question: How can I pay the confirmation fee related to my acceptance?
answer: Each accepted student w​ill receive an acceptance email which will list (with instructions) the available options (ex: online payment, bank transfer, cash) in paying the confirmation fee.

question: Why are students not notified about the possibility to petition to add or change majors on the application form?
answer:
​AUB does not email students about this petition process because
this may not apply to every applicant. However, accepted undergraduate students
have up to one month before their enrollment confirmation deadline to petition
for reconsideration to other majors.

question: Can I do IELTS to meet the English language requirement?
answer: IELTS can be considered to satisfy the AUBEnglish language requirement​, which includes minimum IELTS scores along with additional requirements.

question: Will students be notified of their acceptance or rejection?
answer: Undergraduate applicants are only notified of their acceptance and hence rejection letters are not sent to applicants.  ​Graduate applicants will be notified of their acceptance or rejection.  Notifications are sent by email.

question: MEHE Equivalency Requirements and Processes المعادلات من وزارة التربية و التعليم العالي
answer: For more information on how to authenticate diplomas and degrees at AUB, please clickhere​.​

question: Can I transfer to freshman or sophomore class directly after completing the UPP program?
answer:
​After successfully passing the UPP program, a student may join directly
the AUB freshman class. However, for joining sophomore, the student needs to submit
to the Office of Admissions an undergraduate application with all the required
documents including SAT scores by the set deadlines.

question: I have completed Grade 11, can I apply to AUB UPP Program?
answer:
​Applicants should have completed at least twelve years of schooling, or
equivalent, before joining any program at AUB including UPP.  Applicants
to the UPP program must submit the UPP application form and the high school
transcripts along with a high school recommendation letter.

question: Are there any special requirements for Lebanese or non-Lebanese applicants to the freshman class?
answer:
​A Lebanese or non-Lebanese applicant to the freshman class needs
to obtain a statement (permission) from theEquivalence Committee​(English,Arabic) of the
Lebanese Ministry of Education and Higher Education (MEHE) allowing her/him to join the freshman class.  Moreover, students need to obtain the equivalence of their freshman year at AUB to the Lebanese Baccalaureate ​Part II,​ as required by MEHE.  For details
please refer to the Ministry (English,Arabic) and theAUB Catalog​​. ​

question: What are the requirements for admission to the freshman class?
answer: ​To apply to the freshman class, AUB requires the school grades for the 10th and 11th Grades plus the SAT  scores.  Both SAT  scores and school grades are equally weighted when evaluating applications for admission. For details, please refer to theadmission requirements​.​​

question: What certificates qualify for consideration to the freshman class?
answer:
​Students completing 12 years of schooling and
doing one of the following programs: High School Program, AP
program, IGCSE (O Levels), IB Certificate or any other school leaving
certificate (other than Lebanese Baccalaureate) can apply to the freshman
program at AUB.   Freshman credits equivalences may be given towards
the advanced level courses such as AP.

question: What is the minimum SAT score required for admission?
answer: For early admission, which is criteria based admission, the minimum required SAT score are indicated in theadmission requirements. ​However, for regular admission, there is no required SAT score as regular admission is competition-based and thus depends on the scores of students applying for a given term and on the availability of places.

question: What tests should I take to be considered for admission to the Freshman Class?
answer: The Scholastic Assessment Test (SAT) is required for admission decision and it cannot be substituted by any other test.  You can review details about SAT on theCollege Boardwebsite.​Please note that the registration deadlines for SAT are usually set about a month ahead of the actual exam date. Please also note that when applying for a given term at AUB, you have to meet the "Last SAT session date" considered for that term (thus SAT exams done after that Last SAT Session date will not be considered).

question: Did AUB Office of Admissions receive my official SAT Scores?
answer: Please refer to 'How to send SAT Scores​' instructions for details on how to properly send your SAT Scores.​Regarding the official scores, as long as you successfully ordered your SAT official scores from College Board to be sent to AUB (ETS Code 0902), then they will arrive and be processed by us.​​​

question: What other tests than SAT should I take for admission to AUB? Should I take any English test?​
answer: ​Meeting the English language requirement is a condition to register at AUB if you were accepted.  You can meet theEnglish language requirementby achieving certain minimum scores on your SAT and/or on alternatives English only (ex: TOEFL, IELTS, AUB-EN​ etc.) exams. You might also need to takeAUB’s Writing Placement Test​for placement into English courses.​

question: Can I transfer to Freshman class directly after completing the UPP Program?
answer: ​After successfully passing the UPP program, a student may join directly the AUB Freshman class without the need to take SAT exam.​

question: Can I apply to AUB with Common App?
answer: ​Yes, AUB is a member ofCommon App​. ​

question: Are there any special requirements for Lebanese or non-Lebanese applicants to the sophomore class?
answer:
Lebanese or non-Lebanese applicants to the sophomore class need to
provide evidence of having successfully passed the Lebanese Baccalaureate Part
II or its equivalent. Applicants holding foreign certificates should
obtain the equivalence of the Lebanese Baccalaureate Part II from theEquivalence Committee​(English,Arabic) of the Lebanese Ministry of Education and Higher Education (MEHE) ​prior to registration at AUB.

question: What are the requirements for admission to the sophomore class?
answer: ​To apply to the Sophomore class, AUB requires the school grades for the 10th and 11th Grades plus the SAT scores.  Both SAT scores and school grades are equally weighted when evaluating applications for admission.​ For details please refer to theadmission requirements​.

question: What certificates qualify for consideration to the sophomore class?
answer: Students completing 12 years of schooling and accomplishing one of the following programs: Lebanese Baccalaureate, French Baccalaureate, Syrian Baccalaureate, Jordanian Tawjihi, German Abitur, Official Government Secondary School leaving Certificate, full IB Diploma or IGCSE/GCE(3 A levels or 6 AS levels in addition to 6 O levels excluding Arabic)​, completion of the freshman class at a recognized institution of higher education, can apply directly to the sophomore level at AUB.

question: What is the minimum SAT score required for admission?
answer: For early admission, which is criteria based admission, the minimum required SAT score are indicated in theadmission requirements. ​However, for regular admission, there is no required SAT score as regular admission is competition based and thus depends on the scores of students applying for a given term and on availability of places.

question: What majors are offered at AUB
answer: The list of majors that you can apply to is included in the admission application.​For detailed information on the majors and programs currently offered at AUB,  please refer to theAUB Majors and Programs​page. ​

question: What other tests than SAT should I take for admission to AUB? Should I take any English test?
answer: ​Meeting the English language requirement is a condition to register at AUB if you are accepted.  You can meet theEnglish language requirementby achieving certain minimum scores on your SAT and/or on English alternatives​ only (ex: TOEFL, IELTS, AUB-EN​ etc.) exams. You might also need to takeAUB’s Writing Placement Test​for placement into English courses.

question: What tests should I take to be considered for admission to the sophomore class?
answer: The Scholastic Assessment Test (SAT) is required for admission decision and it cannot be substituted by any other test.  You can review details about SAT on theCollege Boardwebsite.​Please note that the registration deadlines for SAT are usually set about a month ahead of the actual exam date. Please also note that when applying for a given term at AUB, you have to meet the "Last SAT session date" considered for that term (thus SAT exams done after that Last SAT Session date will not be considered).

question: Did you receive my official SAT Scores?
answer: Please refer to 'How to send SAT Scores​' instructions for details on how to properly send your SAT Scores.​Regarding the official scores, as long as you ordered successfully your SAT official scores from College Board to be sent to AUB (ETS Code 0902), then they will arrive and be processed by us.​​

question: I was not accepted into the major that I plan to pursue at AUB, so can I petition for reconsideration?
answer: In general, you can petition (usually latest by 1 month before the confirmation deadline) to add a major which was not considered or reviewed by our admission committee.​For majors that were already reviewed then a petition will not be accepted unless there is a change in the student application file (ex: addition of missing grades, SAT scores, legacy information [parent or grandparents are AUB Alumni] ) that would affect the application decision.​Petitions should be sent in an email, by replying to your acceptance email or application update email, and students will be notified of the petition outcome by email as well.​

question: Can I transfer to sophomore class directly after completing the UPP Program?
answer: After successfully passing the UPP program, a student cannot directly join the AUB sophomore class. The student needs to submit to the Office of Admissions an undergraduate application with all the required documents including SAT scores by the application deadline.

question: Can an applicant transfer at the freshman or sophomore level from another university to AUB?
answer: Students who have completed less than 30 freshman credits may apply to the freshman year at AUB.  Similarly, students who have completed less than 24 sophomore credits may apply to the sophomore year at AUB.  In both cases, SAT and high school grades (G10, G11 and G12) will be considered for admission. Courses taken at the former university, could be given credit upon the recommendation of the department(s) concerned.​

question: Can any student transfer to AUB?
answer: Students enrolled in recognized institutions of higher learning and who have completed a class equivalent to the sophomore class at AUB may be considered for admission to the junior class based on their university GPA.  Such applicants should meet the English language requirement.​

question: Can courses taken at another university be transferred to AUB?
answer: Courses taken at a recognized university could be transferred if they are equivalent to courses offered at AUB under a degree-leading program and upon the recommendation of the department(s) concerned.​Course equivalences are determined after submitting an AUB admission application and are usually issued with the application acceptance decision.​

question: What are the graduation requirements of a transfer applicant?
answer:
​Students should complete the college
requirements in addition to major and credit requirements as determined by the
department(s) concerned and by the Office of the Registrar.

question: What is the minimum average required for transfer admission to AUB?
answer:
​In general, the minimum GPA scores required vary
among majors and admission is based on competition and availability of spaces.

question: Can I apply as a transfer student to another major when I already have a bachelor degree?
answer:
​If you already have a bachelor degree, then you will
need to apply as second degree applicant.  Some of the credits taken in
the bachelor degree will be transferred to your second degree per department
approval.

question: I am an AUB graduate and want to apply to AUB for a second degree, do I submit an application to the Office of Admissions like other second degree applicants?
answer:
​AUB graduates who've been away from AUB for less than
2 years after graduation, must contact the Office of the Registrar on:registrar@aub.edu.lband inquire about
their application for second degree.   For all other applicants, they
need to submit their second degree application form at the Office of
Admissions.

question: Can a special or a visiting undergraduate student take graduate courses?
answer: On case by case review, the student may take graduate courses upon approval of the department concerned.​

question: Can credits taken be considered towards a degree from AUB?
answer:
​Credits taken at AUB may be considered toward
AUB degrees if the student reapplies for admission as a regular student, and is
accepted based on the admission criteria

question: What are the minimum requirements for admission?
answer:
​Students must have a high school diploma, school
leaving certificate, government secondary school certificate or higher level of
education recognized by AUB.  Students must have completed at least one term
at another university recognized by AUB.

question: What is the number of credits allowed?
answer:
​Students may normally take up to 17
undergraduate credits or 9 graduate credits per semester (for a maximum of 2 terms).

question: What kind of study abroad programs do you offer?
answer: Students registered in recognized institutions of higher learning may wish to take courses at AUB without seeking a degree from the university. Those may apply for special not working for a degree or visiting/exchange status.​

question: How can I take Arabic courses at AUB?
answer: To join Arabic courses at AUB, non-degree students can consider the following options:You may apply as anon-degree/visiting/exchangestudentYou might be interested otherwise in short courses which are usually offered by theContinuing Education Center (CEC)​.If you are looking for Arabic summer courses then you might be interested inAUB's Summer Arabic Program​.​​

question: Will the average of courses taken as special or visiting student be considered for admissions to a regular graduate program at AUB?
answer:
​In general, that average is not considered
towards admissions; however, for borderline cases and on a case by case basis
the admission committee might consider this average along with other criteria
for admission to regular status.

question: What diplomas are currently offered at AUB?
answer: Some of the diplomas that we offer include:​-Teaching Diploma Program​-Diploma in Special Education​-Diploma in Educational Management and Leadership​

question: I would like to apply for a diploma, do I need to take an English exam?
answer: You will need to meet theEnglish language requirements​​.

question: I would like to apply for a teaching diploma, what are the requirements and the concentrations
answer: Please refer to our detailedadmission requirementsfor diploma applications.You may refer to thediploma application​for the list of available concentrations of the Teaching Diploma.​

question: How many years is the MD program?
answer: The MD program is a graduate four-year program following a 3-4 years pre-med bachelor's degree, after which the student will be awarded the degree of Doctor of Medicine.​For more details, please refer to theAUB Admissionswebsite or theFaculty of Medicine​website.

question: What are the admission requirements to the MD program at AUB?
answer: Students are required to: ​1- Hold a bachelor´s degree (including the pre-medical core courses as listed in the AUB catalogue) ​2- Take the Medical College Admission Test (MCAT) ​3- Meet theEnglish language requirement​​

question: I am doing my pre-med major at another university, can I apply to AUB MD program?
answer: Every year AUB receives a number of applications from Lebanon and overseas from students who did not complete their bachelor studies at AUB.  Thus, you can apply to AUB MD program as long as you have completed all the pre-medical core courses as listed in the AUB catalogue and you meet the other admission requirements.You may contact theschool of medicine​to clarify if the pre-medical courses taken outside AUB are equivalent to AUB courses.

question: Graduate FAQ
answer: Please refer to theFAQ for Masters or PhDapplicants.
